main event: One round, orangish-red object the size of a dime held at arm's length was observed on Ground Radar at China Lake NAS, California, on July 7, 1955.
interesting points: The object made rapid changes of direction, speed, and altitude., Pilots in the area reported seeing the object visually at the same time., The object was discredited as a balloon but no conclusion was drawn regarding its identity., This incident is receiving a follow-up investigation by Bluelight 12 and Data., Witnesses used binoculars to observe the object, which they described as glowing.
witness description: control tower operators at China Lake Naval Air Facility
